English Sentences: Paul, a prisoner of Jesus Christ, and Timothy our brother, unto Philemon our dearly beloved, and fellowlabourer,
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani PHauloosi, Yesuus Kiristtoosa gishshau qashuwan de7iyaageenne nu ishaa Ximootiyoosi, nunaara oottiya nuuni siiqiyo Pilimoonayyo,

English Sentences: And to our beloved Apphia, and Archippus our fellowsoldier, and to the church in thy house:
Wolaitta Sentences: ne sooni shiiqiya woosa keettaayyo, nu michchee Afiibiyyoonne nunaara issippe de7iya wotaaddaraa Arkkipoosayyo ha dabddaabbiyaa xaafoos.

English Sentences: Grace to you, and peace, from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xoossaa nu Aawaappenne nu Godaa Yesuus Kiristtoosappe aaro kehatettainne sarotettai intteyyo gido.

English Sentences: I thank my God, making mention of thee always in my prayers,
Wolaitta Sentences: Neeni geeshshata siiqiyoogaanne Godaa Yesuusa ammaniyoogaa taani siyiyo gishshau,

English Sentences: Hearing of thy love and faith, which thou hast toward the Lord Jesus, and toward all saints;
Wolaitta Sentences: Xoossaa woossaidda nena hassayiyo wode ubban, ta Xoossaa galatais.

English Sentences: That the communication of thy faith may become effectual by the acknowledging of every good thing which is in you in Christ Jesus.
Wolaitta Sentences: Neeni ne ammanuwaa haratuura shaakkiyoogee nuuyyo Kiristtoos Yesuusa baggaara yiya lo77obaa ubbaa erissana mala, taani Xoossaa woossais.

English Sentences: For we have great joy and consolation in thy love, because the bowels of the saints are refreshed by thee, brother.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, geeshshatu wozanai ne oosuwan minnido gishshau, ta ishau, taani ne siiquwan daro ufaissaanne minttettuwaa demmaas.

English Sentences: Wherefore, though I might be much bold in Christ to enjoin thee that which is convenient,
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gishshau, neeni oottanau bessiyaabaa oottana mala, taani nena azazanau Kiristtoosa baggaara xalikkokka,

English Sentences: Yet for love's sake I rather beseech thee, being such an one as Paul the aged, and now also a prisoner of Jesus Christ.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani PHauloosi cimidaagee, Kiristtoos Yesuusayyo ha77ikka qashuwan de7iyaagee, siiquwaa gishshau, nena woossais.

English Sentences: I beseech thee for my son Onesimus, whom I have begotten in my bonds:
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani qashuwan de7aidda ayyo aawa gidido ta na7aa Anaasimoosa gishshau, nena woossais.

English Sentences: Which in time past was to thee unprofitable, but now profitable to thee and to me:
Wolaitta Sentences: I kase nena go77enna; shin ha77i nenakka tanakka tumu go77ees.

English Sentences: Whom I have sent again: thou therefore receive him, that is, mine own bowels:
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani wozanappe dosiyo Anaasimoosa neekko yeddais.

English Sentences: Whom I would have retained with me, that in thy stead he might have ministered unto me in the bonds of the gospel:
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani wonggeliyaa gishshau qashetta uttidaashin, ne gishshaa tau oottidi, tana maaddana mala, ta matan a ashshanau koyais.

English Sentences: But without thy mind would I do nothing; that thy benefit should not be as it were of necessity, but willingly.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin neeni ne shenedan oottanaagaa koyaisippe attin, nenaara zorettennan wolqqan ainne oottanau koyikke.

English Sentences: For perhaps he therefore departed for a season, that thou shouldest receive him for ever;
Wolaitta Sentences: Anaasimoosi guutta wodiyaa neeppe shaahettidoogee, ooni erii simmidi, ubba wodekka nenaara de7anaassakkonne.

English Sentences: Not now as a servant, but above a servant, a brother beloved, specially to me, but how much more unto thee, both in the flesh, and in the Lord?
Wolaitta Sentences: Simmi hagaappe sinttau Anaasimoosi aille gidenna; shin ailleppe i keehi aadhdhees; i taayyo ai keena siiqo ishee! Qassi i neeyyo asa baggaarakka Godaa baggaarakka ai keena aadhdhida isha gidanddeeshsha!

English Sentences: If thou count me therefore a partner, receive him as myself.
Wolaitta Sentences: Simmi neeni tana ne lagge giyaabaa gidikko, tana mokkiyoogaadan, a mokka.

English Sentences: If he hath wronged thee, or oweth thee ought, put that on mine account;
Wolaitta Sentences: I neeyyo mooridobai woi a bolli neeyyo acoi de7ikko, taappe qanxxuwaa ekka.

English Sentences: I Paul have written it with mine own hand, I will repay it: albeit I do not say to thee how thou owest unto me even thine own self besides.
Wolaitta Sentences: He acuwaa taani qanxxana gaada, taani PHauloosi ta kushiyan xaafais. Neeni tau ne shemppuwaa acota uttidoogaa taani nena hassayissanau koshshenna.

English Sentences: Yea, brother, let me have joy of thee in the Lord: refresh my bowels in the Lord.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ee ta ishau, Godaa baggaara neeppe go77a demmanau koyais. Kiristtoosa baggaara tana minttetta.

English Sentences: Having confidence in thy obedience I wrote unto thee, knowing that thou wilt also do more than I say.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani giidoogaappe daruwaa neeni oottanaagaa erada, qassi ne tau azazettanaagaakka ammanada, hagaa neeyyo xaafais.

English Sentences: But withal prepare me also a lodging: for I trust that through your prayers I shall be given unto you.
Wolaitta Sentences: Qassi intte he sohuwaarakka taayyo imatti shemppiyo keetta giigissite. Aissi giikko, Xoossai intte woosan tana intteyyo guyye zaaridi immana gaada qoppais.

English Sentences: There salute thee Epaphras, my fellowprisoner in Christ Jesus;
Wolaitta Sentences: Kiristtoos Yesuusa gishshau, tanaara qashuwan de7iya Eppaafiri nena saro saro gees.

English Sentences: Marcus, Aristarchus, Demas, Lucas, my fellowlabourers.
Wolaitta Sentences: Qassi tanaara issippe oottiya Marqqoosi, Arisxxirokoosi, Deemaasinne Luqaasi nena saro saro goosona.

English Sentences: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit. Amen.
Wolaitta Sentences: Godaa Yesuus Kiristtoosa aaro kehatettai intte ayyaanaara gido.
